title: Colombian political candidate is caught with 'cocaine in his PROSTHETIC LEG' before boarding a plane
text:
A political candidate has been busted at an airport in Colombia with seven kilos of cocaine hidden inside his prosthetic leg.

Víctor Hugo Agudelo was about to board a Frankfort-bound flight October 7 at El Dorado International Airport in Bogotá when narcotics officers approached him seeking to know if he needed assistance because they noticed something was wrong with his leg.

An argument the broke out between the aspiring Valle del Cauca councilman and the Colombian National Police agents, with Agudelo insisting he was a community leader and disabled.

A member \of Colombia's National Police (left) carries Víctor Hugo Agudelo's prosthetic leg while another agent (right) pushes him along in a wheelchair. He was still released from police custody after cocaine was discovered in his prosthetic leg

Víctor Hugo Agudelo (left) was busted by Colombian narcotic officers at Bogotá's El Dorado International Airport on October 7 as he attempted to board a flight to Frankfort, Germany, with seven kilos of cocaine hidden inside his prosthetic leg. Agudelo is a running for the council seat in La Unión, a municipality in the department of El Valle del Cauca

Narcotic agents at Bogotá's El Dorado International Airport noticed through a scanner that something was hidden inside the political candidate's prosthetic leg. They later discovered seven kilos of cocaine

After doing a check of his previous travel history and noticing that he was having difficulties walking, the law enforcement agents placed him in a wheelchair.

The narcotics agents subsequently came across the shocking discovery of the contraband when they placed the prosthetic leg through a scanner.

The drugs have a United States street value of $175,000.

However, for reasons unknown, Agudelo was released from custody shortly after.

The candidate was spotted at a public event a couple of days after his capture in the municipality of La Unión, where he is running for office.

Colombian authorities seized seven kilos of cocaine that were secretly hidden inside a political candidate's prosthetic leg (pictured)

Víctor Hugo Agudelo is still campaigning for the council seat. His campaign slogan reads: 'He who does not live to serve is not good enough to live!'

Agudelo also participated in an October 14 campaign event in La Unión with William Palomino, the mayoral candidate, and Clara Luz Roldán, who is running for the Valle del Cauca governor's seat.

In a recent social media post, Agudelo said: 'I'm still here with my people, I'm still working, I'm part of the Radical Change group and I'm moving on confidently.'

However, Radical Change party leaders are already working with the National Electorate Council to remove his party membership.

'I reject any action that is outside the law and more in the case of a crime as unfortunate as drug trafficking is,' Senator José Luis Pérez said, according to Colombian outlet Blu Radio.

Víctor Hugo Agudelo goes through a security scanner at an airport in Colombia where he was caught trying to board a flight with seven kilos of cocaine. Since his release, he has been spotted at two campaign events but his party, Radical Change, is fighting to have his membership removed
description: Víctor Hugo Agudelo is still campaigning for a council seat in Colombia weeks after he was caught trying to board a flight to Germany with cocaine stuffed in his prosthetic leg.
